main event: A round, medium-sized light was observed at the head of Penncove Bay, Whidbey Island on February 2, 1958.
interesting points: The light started as a dull red and changed to a high intensity blue-white., The observed duration was approximately 3 minutes., The light was seen descending at a straight angle of 15 degrees., It was reported that the light moved too slowly to be a flare or meteor., The sighting occurred at a distance estimated at 45 degrees true.
witness description: Lt/Con Holden from the Naval Air Station
